parameters.Name: ACT_BND
parameters.Instances: Since inter-/extrapolation default is MIG, the bound must be explicitly specified for each period, unless an inter-/extrapolation option is set. If the bound is specified for a timeslice s above the process timeslice resolution (prc_tsl), the bound is applied to the sum of the activity variables according to the timeslice tree. Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description: Bound on the overall activity a process.
parameters.Equations: Activity limit constraint (EQ(l)_ACTBND) when s is above prc_tsl. Direct bound on activity variable (VAR_ACT) when at the prc_tsl level.

parameters.Name: ACT_COST
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per unit of activity [open]
parameters.Instances: Variable costs associated with the activity of a process.
parameters.Description: none
parameters.Equations: Applied to the activity variable (VAR_ACT) as a component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTPL
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per unit of activity [0,∞)
parameters.Instances: Used as an alternative or supplement to using ACT_LOSPL(r,y,p,'FX'). When used as an alternative, the fuel increase at the minimum operating level that should be included in the cost penalty must be embedded in the ACT_CSTPL coefficient.
parameters.Description: Partial load cost penalty, defined as an additional cost per activity at the minimum operating level, corresponding to the efficiency loss at that load level. Added as an extra term to variable costs in the objective and reporting.
parameters.Equations: Generates an additional term in EQ_OBJVAR for the increase in operating cost.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTRMP
parameters.Units/Ranges: Corrency unit per unit of capacity (change in load) [0,∞)
parameters.Instances: Can be used for standard processes in basic, advanced and discrete unit commitment extensions. Can also be used for load-shifting processes for defining the cost of shifting loads per unit of demand load by one hour.
parameters.Description: Defines ramp-up (L=UP) or ramp-down (L=LO) cost per unit of load change (in capacity units). Forload-shifting processes defines the cost of shifting one unit of load by one hour, forward (UP) or backward (LO).
parameters.Equations: Activates generation of EQ_ACTRMPC. Generates an additional term in EQ_OBJVAR for the increase in operating cost.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTSD
parameters.Units/Ranges: Currency units per unit of started-up capacity [0,∞)
parameters.Instances: Activates the advanced unit commitment option. In the case of the shut-down costs, only the tuple (upt, bd) = (HOT, LO) is a valid instance for this parameter. Requires the parameter ACT_MAXNON to be defined as well.
parameters.Description: Defines start-up (bd=UP) and shutdown costs (bd=LO) per unit of started-up capacity, differentiated by start-up type (upt). The start-up type of a power plant depends on its non-operational time after shut-down, as defined by using ACT_MAXNON.
parameters.Equations: Generates an additional term in EQ_OBJVAR for the increase in operating cost.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTUP
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per unit of capacity [0,∞)
parameters.Instances: The tslvl level refers to the timeslice cycle for which the start-up cost is defined. Only applicable when the min. stable operating level has been defined with ACT_MINLD.
parameters.Description: Cost of process start-up per unit of started-up capacity. Added as an extra term to variable costs in the objective and reporting.
parameters.Equations: Activates generation of EQL_ACTUPS eqs. Generates an additional term in the variable operating costs included in EQ_OBJVAR.

parameters.Name: ACT_CUM
parameters.Instances: The years y1 and y2 may be any years of the set allyear; where y1 may also be 'BOH' for first year of first period and y2 may be 'EOH' for last year of last period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the cumulative amount of annual process activity between the years y1 and y2, within a region.
parameters.Equations: Generates an instance of the cumulative constraint (EQ_CUMFLO)

parameters.Name: ACT_EFF
parameters.Instances: The group cg may be a single commodity, group, or commodity type on the shadow side, or a single commodity in the PCG; cg='ACT' refers to the default shadow group. If no group efficiency is defined, shadow group is assumed to be the commodity type. Individual commodity efficiencies are multiplied with the shadow group efficiency (default=1). Levelized to the timeslice level of the flow variables in the shadow group. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Activity efficiency for process, i.e. amount of activity per unit of commodity flows in the group cg. For more information on usage, see Section 6.3 for details about EQE_ACTEFF.
parameters.Equations: Generates instances of the activity efficiency constraint (EQE_ACTEFF)

parameters.Name: ACT_FLO
parameters.Instances: Inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the the process flow (cg=com) or the process activity (when cg=genuine group). Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Flow of commodities in cg in proportion to the process activity, in timeslice s. Non-vintaged variant available for vintaged processes by using a negative FLO_FUNCX.
parameters.Equations: Establishes a transformation relationship (EQ_PTRANS) between the flows in the PCG and one or more input (or output) commodities.

parameters.Name: ACT_LOSPL
parameters.Default values: FX: none, LO: default value is ACT_MINLD or 0.1 if that is not defined, UP: 0.6
parameters.Instances: Endogenous partial load modeling can only be used for processes that have their efficiency modelled by the ACT_EFF parameter, which must be defined on the shadow side of the process. For other processes, the ACT_CSTPL parameter can be used for modeling a cost penalty at partial loads.
parameters.Description: Partial load efficiency parameters. 1) (bd='FX'): Proportional increase in specific fuel con- sumption at minimum operating level 2) (bd='LO'): Minimum operating level of partial load operation 3) (bd='UP'): Fraction of feasible load range above the minimum operating level, below which the efficiency losses are assumed to occur.
parameters.Equations: Generates instances of the partial load efficiency constraint EQ_ACTPL.

parameters.Name: ACT_LOSSD
parameters.Instances: Can only be used when the advanced unit commitment option is used for the process (therefore, defining both ACT_CSTSD and ACT_MAXNON is required) Requires also that ACT_EFF has been used for defining the process efficiency (on the shadow side of the process).
parameters.Description: Used for modeling endogenous partial load efficiency losses during the start-up and shut-down phase. ·With bd=UP defines increase in specific fuel consumption at the start up load level defined by the ratio ACT_MINLD / ACT_SDTIME(upt,'UP') for start-up type upt; ·With bd=LO defines the increase in specific fuel consump- tion at the start up load level defined by the ratio ACT_MINLD / ACT_SDTIME('HOT', 'LO').
parameters.Equations: Activates generation of EQ_SUDPLL

parameters.Name: ACT_MAXNON
parameters.Instances: Can only be used when the advanced unit commitment option is used for the process (thus defining ACT_CSTSD is required)
parameters.Description: Max. non-operational time before transition to next stand-by condition, by start-up type, in hours ·Defines the max. non-operational time before a subsequent start-up of type upt.
parameters.Equations: Activates generation of EQ_SUDUPT

parameters.Name: ACT_MINLD
parameters.Instances: Can only be used for standard processes (not IRE or STG). Must be defined if ACT_CSTUP or ACT_TIME is specified.
parameters.Description: Minimum stable operating level of a dispatchable process.
parameters.Equations: Generates instances of equations EQ_CAPLOAD and EQE_ACTUPS.

parameters.Name: ACT_SDTIME
parameters.Instances: Can only be used when ACT_CSTSD is specified for the process (advanced unit commitment option) When specifying the duration of the shut-down phase, only the tuple (upt,bd)=(HOT,LO) is valid
parameters.Description: Defines the duration of start-up (bd=UP) and shut-down (bd=LO) phases, by start-up type, in hours.
parameters.Equations: Activates generation of EQ_SUDTIME, and used also in the equations EQ_ACTPL EQ_SDSLANT EQ_SDMINON EQ_SUDPLL

parameters.Name: ACT_TIME
parameters.Instances: Can be used for standard processes when start-up costs have been modeled, using both ACT_MINLD and ACT_CSTUP at the DAYNITE/WEEKLY level. The lim type 'FX' is not supported for this use, and is ignored. Can also be used for load-shifting storage processes, for defining the maximum delay/advance of load shift, or the time-window for load balancing (cf. Sect. 4.3.9).
parameters.Description: 1) Minimum online (UP) / offline (LO) hours of a process with start-up costs modeled (lim=LO/UP) 2) Maximum number of start-up cycles within process time- slice cycles (lim=N). 3) Maximum delay or advance of load shift (lim=UP/LO/FX) or load balancing time (lim=N) for a load- shifting storage.
parameters.Equations: Generates instances of EQL_ACTUPC. For load-shifting storage processes, generates instances of EQ_SLSIFT.

parameters.Name: ACT_UPS
parameters.Instances: Inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the process activity. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. The ramp rates can only be specified with bd=LO/UP.
parameters.Description: Maximum ramp-rate (down/up) of process activity as a fraction of nominal on-line capacity per hour.
parameters.Equations: Generates instances of equation EQ_ACTRAMP.

parameters.Name: B
parameters.Instances: Required for each milestone year, but is auto-generated if not specified
parameters.Description: Beginning year of period t.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: BS_BNDPRS
parameters.Instances: Not levelized (inherited or aggregated), but applied only directly on the timeslice s specified. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Absolute bound on the reserve provision b from process p.
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS27

parameters.Name: BS_CAPACT
parameters.Instances: Applied also for the reporting of reserves in terms of power levels. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from exogenous reserve demand from capacity to activity / commodity flow units
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS04

parameters.Name: BS_DELTA
parameters.Instances: Levelized to COM_TSL of b. Calibration parameters for probabilistic reserve demand b, in region r, and timeslice s. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: none
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_DEMDET
parameters.Units/Ranges: Unit for EXOGEN: capacity unit Unit for WMAXSI: dimensionless (fraction of capacity)
parameters.Instances: rsp='EXOGEN': Exogenous reserve demand for reserve b, in region r, timeslice s. ·rsp='WMAXSI': Weight of the contribution of the largest system element in deterministic reserve demand b, in region r, timeslice s. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Parameters for deterministic demands of reserves (rsp = EXOGEN or WMAXSI)
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS04

parameters.Name: BS_DETWT
parameters.Instances: See the ABS documentation for details.
parameters.Description: Weight of the deterministic component in the formulation for endogenous requirements of reserve b in region r
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_LAMBDA
parameters.Instances: Required. If not defined, then the demand for reserve b cannot be calculated. See the ABS documentation for details.
parameters.Description: Fudge factors for dependencies in the reserve requirements calculated for reserve b in region r, in year datayear
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_MAINT
parameters.Units/Ranges: hours (if over 24 hours, continuous over whole season) (0,∞)
parameters.Instances: Levelized to PRC_TSL. If defined on DAYNITE or WEEKLY level, requires start-ups explicitly enabled on that level (using ACT_CSTUP/ACT_CSTSD).
parameters.Description: For endogenous maintenance scheduling, defines minimum continuous maintenance time of process p, vintage v,
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS27, EQ_BS28

parameters.Name: BS_OMEGA
parameters.Instances:
Required for enabling
reserve provision
formulation.
Levelized to COM_TSL of b.
See the ABS
documentation for details
parameters.Description:
Indicator denoting if
the demand for
reserve b is the
weighted sum of the
deterministic and
probabilistic
component ( ω=2),
the maximum of the
two (ω=1), or their
difference ( ω=3)
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_RMAX
parameters.Instances:
Required for enabling
reserve provision from any
non-storage processes.
Levelized to PRC_TSL.
See the ABS
documentation for details
parameters.Description:
Maximum
contribution of
process p, vintage v,
in timeslice s to the
provision of reserve
commodity b.
parameters.Equations:
EQ_BS11
EQ_BS19

parameters.Name: BS_RTYPE
parameters.Instances:
Required for enabling
reserve provision
calculations.
See the ABS
documentation for details
parameters.Description:
Type of reserve
commodity b, positive
or negative ± 1–4:
 ±1 : FCR reserve
 ±2 : AFRR reserve
 ±3 : MFRR reserve
 ±4 : RR reserve
parameters.Equations:
EQ_BS00
EQ_BS01
EQ_BS11
EQ_BS18
EQ_BS19
EQ_BS26

parameters.Name: BS_SHARE
parameters.Instances:
The group grp can be
defined by GR_GENMAP, or
implicitly for any single
process prc=grp.
See the ABS
documentation for details
parameters.Description:
Maximum (bd=UP) or
minimum (bd=LO)
share of process
group grp in the
demand for reserve
b, in region r, where
demand is measured
as defined by
BS_OMEGA
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS01

parameters.Name: BS_SIGMA
parameters.Instances:
Levelized to finest ts-level.
See the ABS
documentation for details
parameters.Description:
Standard deviation of
forecast error for the
imbalance source
grp, in region r,
timeslice s, used for
calculating the
demand for reserve b
parameters.Equations: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_STIME
parameters.Instances:
Required that 'UP' ≥ 'LO'.
See the ABS
documentation for details
parameters.Description:
Defines the times for
reserve provision
from storage process
p for reserve b in
region r(in hours):
·bd='LO': Time
required to ramp
up in order to
provide reserve b
·bd='UP': Duration
of provision for
reserve b including
time to ramp up
parameters.Equations:
EQ_BS22
EQ_BS23

parameters.Name: CAP_BND
parameters.Instances:
Since inter-/extrapolation is
default is MIG, a bound
must be specified for each
period desired, if no explicit
inter-/extrapolation option
is given. Relaxed if upper
bound less than existing
non-retirable capacity.
parameters.Description:
Bound on investment
in new capacity.Imposes an indirect
limit on the capacity
transfer equation
(EQ_CPT) by means of
a direct bound on the
capacity variable
(VAR_CAP).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: CM_CONST
parameters.Instances:
See Appendix on Climate
Module for details.
parameters.Description:
Various climate
module constants,
e.g. phi and sigma
values between
reservoirs.
parameters.Equations:
EQ_CLITOT
EQ_CLICONC
EQ_CLITEMP
EQ_CLIBEOH

parameters.Name: CM_EXOFORC
parameters.Instances:
Default values are
provided. See Appendix on
Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description:
Radiative forcing from
exogenous sources
parameters.Equations: EQ_CLITOT

parameters.Name: CM_GHGMAP
parameters.Units/Ranges:
Units of climate
module emissions per
units of regional
emissions
[0,∞);
parameters.Instances:
The global emissions in the
climate module (cm_var)
are 'CO2-GtC' (GtC), 'CH4-
Mt' (Mt) and 'N2O-Mt' (Mt).
See Appendix on Climate
Module for details.
parameters.Description:
Mapping and
conversion of regional
GHG emissions to
global emissions in
the climate module
parameters.Equations: EQ_CLITOT

parameters.Name: CM_HISTORY
parameters.Instances:
Default values are provided
until 2010. See Appendix
on Climate Module for
details.
parameters.Description:
Calibration values for
CO2 and forcing
parameters.Equations:
EQ_CLITOT
EQ_CLICONC
EQ_CLITEMP
EQ_CLIBEOH

parameters.Name: CM_LINFOR
parameters.Instances:
With lim types LO/UP, CO2
forcing function can be
automatically linearized
between the concentration
levels given. For CH4 and
N2O, lim types FX/N must
be used (N=concentration
multiplier, FX=constant
term). See Appendix on
Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description:
Parameters of
linearized forcing
functions
parameters.Equations: EQ_CLITOT

parameters.Name: CM_MAXC
parameters.Instances:
Since no default inter-
/extrapolation, bounds
must be explicitly specified
for each desired year,
unless an explicit inter-
/extrapolation option is set.
See Appendix on Climate
Module for details.
parameters.Description:
Maximum level of
climate variable
parameters.Equations: EQ_CLIMAX

parameters.Name: COM_AGG
parameters.Instances:
When commodity lim_type
is LO and commodity type
is not DEM, VAR_COMNET
of c1 is aggregated to c2;
When commodity lim_type
is FX/N or commodity type
is DEM, VAR_COMPRD of c1
is aggregated to c2.
parameters.Description:
Aggregation of
commodity NET/PRD
production to the
production side of the
balance of another
commodity.
parameters.Equations:
Adds a term in
EQ(l)_COMBAL and
EQ(l)_COMPRD.

parameters.Name: COM_BNDNET
parameters.Instances:
Remark: All
VAR_COMNET
variables are by
default non-negative,
i.e. have lower
bounds of zero
Since inter-/extrapolation
default is MIG, a bound
must be specified for each
period desired, if no explicit
inter-/extrapolation option
is given.
If the bound is specified for
a timeslice s above the
commodity timeslice
resolution (com_tsl), the
bound is applied to the sum
of the net commodity
variables (VAR_COMNET)
below it, according to the
timeslice tree.
Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Limit on the net
amount of a
commodity (variable
VAR_COMNET) within
a region for a
particular timeslice.
parameters.Equations:
The balance constraint
is set to an equality
(EQE_COMBAL).
Either the finer
timeslice variables are
summed
(EQ(l)_BNDNET) or the
bound applied direct to
the commodity net
variable(VAR_COMNET)
when at the commodity
level (com_tsl).

parameters.Name: COM_BNDPRD
parameters.Instances:
Remark: All
VAR_COMPRD
variables are by
default non-negative,
i.e. have lower
bounds of zero
Since inter-/extrapolation
default is MIG, a bound
must be specified for each
period desired, if no explicit
inter-/extrapolation option
is given.
If the bound is specified for
a timeslice s being above
the commodity timeslice
resolution (com_tsl), the
bound is applied to the sum
of the commodity
production variables
(VAR_COMPRD) below it,
according to the timeslice
tree.
Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Limit on the amount
of a commodity
produced (variable
VAR_COMPRD)
within a region for a
particular timeslice.
parameters.Equations:
The balance constraint
is set to an equality
(EQE_COMBAL).
Finer timeslice variables
summed
(EQ(l)_BNDPRD).
or the bound is applied
direct to the commodity
production variable
(VAR_COMPRD) when
at the commodity level
(com_tsl).

parameters.Name: COM_BPRICE
parameters.Instances:
The control parameter
$SET TIMESED ‘YES’ to
activate elastic demands
must be set.
parameters.Description:
Base price of a
demand commodity
for the elastic
demand formulation.
parameters.Equations:
Controls the inclusion of
the elastic demand
variable (VAR_ELAST)
in the commodity
balance
equation(EQ(l)_COMBA
L)
Applied to the elastic
demand variable
(VAR_ELAST) in the
objective function
(EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: COM_CSTNET
parameters.Instances:
Direct inheritance.
Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Cost on the net
amount of a
commodity within a
region for a particular
timeslice.
parameters.Equations:
Forces the net
commodity variable
(VAR_COMNET) to be
included in the equality
balance constraint
(EQE_COMBAL).
Applied to said variable
in the cost component
of the objective
function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_CSTPRD
parameters.Instances:
Direct inheritance.
Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Cost on the
production of a
commodity, within a
region for a particular
timeslice.
parameters.Equations:
Forces the commodity
production variable
(VAR_COMPRD) to be
included in the equality
balance constraint
(EQE_COMBAL).
Applied to said variable
in the cost component
of the objective
function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_CUMNET
parameters.Instances:
The years y1 and y2 may
be any years of the set
allyear; where y1 may also
be ‘BOH’ for first year of
first period and y2 may be
‘EOH’ for last year of last
period.
parameters.Description:
Bound on the
cumulative net
amount of a
commodity between
the years y1 and y2,
within a region over
timeslices.
parameters.Equations:
Forces the net
commodity variable
(VAR_COMNET) to be
included in the equality
balance constraint
(EQE_COMBAL).
Generates the
cumulative commodity
constraint
(EQ(l)_CUMNET).

parameters.Name: COM_CUMPRD
parameters.Instances:
The years y1 and y2 may
be any years of the set
allyear; where y1 may also
be ‘BOH’ for first year of
first period and y2 may be
‘EOH’ for last year of last
period.
parameters.Description:
Bound on the
cumulative production
of a commodity
between the years y1
and y2 within a
region over
timeslices.
parameters.Equations:
Forces the net
commodity variable
(VAR_COMPRD) to be
included in the balance
equation
(EQE_COMBAL).
The cumulative
constraint is generated
(EQ(l)_CUMPRD).

parameters.Name: COM_ELAST
parameters.Instances:
The control parameter
$SET TIMESED YES must
be set to activate elastic
demands.
An elasticity is required for
each direction the demand
is permitted to move.
The index lim = 'LO'
corresponds to demand
decrease, while lim = 'UP'
denotes the direction for
demand increase.
A different value may be
provided for each direction,
thus curves may be
asymmetric.
Substitution elasticities can
be defined with lim='N',
among a group of demands
aggregated by COM_AGG.
parameters.Description:
Elasticity of demand
indicating how much
the demand rises/falls
in response to a unit
change in the
marginal cost of
meeting a demand
that is elastic.
See also Appendix D
for additional details
on defining demand
functions.
parameters.Equations:
Controls the inclusion of
the elastic demand
variable (VAR_ELAST)
in the commodity
balance
equation(EQ(l)_COMBA
L)
 Applied to the elastic
demand variable
(VAR_ELAST) in the
objective function costs
(EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: COM_ELASTX
parameters.Instances:
Provided when shaping of
elasticity based upon
demand level is desired.
Note: Shape index 1 is
reserved for constant 1.
parameters.Description:
Shape index for the
elasticity of demand
parameters.Equations:
Affects the demand
elasticities applied in
EQ_OBJELS

parameters.Name: COM_FR
parameters.Instances:
Normally defined only for
demand commodities
(com_type = 'DEM'), but
can be applied to any
commodity for defining
load profiles.
Affects timeslice resolution
at which a commodity is
tracked (RTCS_TSFR), and
thereby may affect when a
process cannot operate
(rtps_off).
Weighted inheritance.
Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Fraction of the annual
demand (COM_PROJ)
or commodity flow
occurring in timeslice
s; describes the
shape of the load
curve.
parameters.Equations:
Applied to the annual
demand (COM_PROJ)
as the RHS of the
balance equation
(EQ(l)_COMBAL).
Enters the peaking
equation (EQ_PEAK), if
a peaking commodity.
Applied to the bounds
of elastic demand step
variables (VAR_ELAST).
Applied via RTFCS_FR
in all equations to flows
having a timeslice level
coarser than target
level.

parameters.Name: COM_IE
parameters.Instances:
Direct inheritance.
Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Infrastructure or
transmission
efficiency of a
commodity.
parameters.Equations:
Overall efficiency
applied to the total
production of a
commodity in the
commodity balance
equation
(EQ(l)_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: COM_MSHGV
parameters.Instances:
Required for all markets
modeled with the logit
market sharing mechanism
parameters.Description:
In the logit market
sharing mechanism,
defines heterogeneity
value for market c in
region r, between the
investment choices
parameters.Equations: EQ_MSNCAPB

parameters.Name: COM_PKFLX
parameters.Instances:
Direct inheritance.
Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description:
Difference between
the average demand
and the peak demand
in timeslice s,
expressed as fraction
of the average
demand.
parameters.Equations:
Applied to the total
consumption of a
commodity to raise the
capacity needed to
satisfy the peaking
constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: COM_PKRSV
parameters.Instances:
Requires that commodity c
is also requested to have
peaking constraints, by
defining COM_PEAK or
COM_PKTS
parameters.Description:
Peak reserve margin
as fraction of peak
demand, e.g. if
COM_PKRSV = 0.2,
the total installed
capacity must exceed
the peak load by
20%.
parameters.Equations:
Applied to the total
consumption of a
commodity to raise the
capacity needed to
satisfy the peaking
constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: COM_PROJ
parameters.Instances:
In standard usage, only
applicable to demand
commodities (com_type =
‘DEM’).
In advanced usage, may
also be specified for other
commodities for defining an
exogenous demand.
Demand is allocated to
sub-annual timeslices
according to COM_FR.
parameters.Description:
Projected annual
demand for a
commodity.
parameters.Equations:
Serves as the RHS
(after COM_FR applied)
of the commodity
balance constraint
(EQ(l)_COMBAL).
Enters the peaking
equation (EQ_PEAK), if
a peaking commodity.
Applied when setting
the upper bound of an
elastic demand step
(VAR_ELAST).

parameters.Name: COM_STEP
parameters.Instances:
The control parameter
$SET TIMESED ‘YES’ must
parameters.Description:
Number of steps to
use for the
parameters.Equations:
Controls the instance of
the elastic demand

parameters.Name: COM_VOC
parameters.Instances: The control parameter $SET TIMESED ‘YES’ to be set to activate elastic demands must be set. A number is required for each direction the demand is permitted to move. The index bd = LO corresponds to the direction of decreasing the demand, while bd = UP denotes the direction for demand increase. A different value may be provided for each direction, thus curves may be asymmetric.
parameters.Description: Possible variation of demand in both directions when using the elastic demand formulation.
parameters.Equations: Applied when setting the bound of an elastic demand step (VAR_ELAST). Applied to the elasticity variable in the objective function costs (EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: COM_SUBNET
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Subsidy on the net amount of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Equations: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMNET) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied (-) to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_SUBPRD
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Subsidy on the production of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Equations: Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied (-) to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_TAXNET
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Tax on the net amount of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Equations: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMNET) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_TAXPRD
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Tax on the production of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Equations: Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: DAM_BQTY
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: N/AOnly effective when DAM_COST has been defined for commodity c.
parameters.Description: Base quantity of emissions for damage cost accounting
parameters.Equations:
EQ_DAMAGE
EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_COST
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDamage costs are by default endogenous (included in the objective). To set them exogenous, use $SET DAMAGE NO
parameters.Description: Marginal damage cost of emissions at Base quantity.
parameters.Equations:
EQ_DAMAGE
EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_ELAST
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: N/AOnly effective when DAM_COST has been defined for commodity c.
parameters.Description: Elasticity of damage cost in the lower or upper direction from Base quantity.
parameters.Equations: EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_STEP
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: N/AOnly effective when DAM_COST has been defined for commodity c.
parameters.Description: Number of steps for linearizing damage costs in the lower or upper direction from Base quantity.
parameters.Equations:
EQ_DAMAGE
EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_VOC
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: N/AOnly effective when DAM_COST is defined for c. Step sizes proportional to the Base quantity can be defined with lim='N'.
parameters.Description: Variance of emissions in the lower or upper direction from Base quantity as a fraction of Base quantity.
parameters.Equations: EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: E
parameters.Instances: For each modelyear period
parameters.Description: End year of period t, used in determining the length of each period
parameters.Equations: The amount of new investment (VAR_NCAP) carried over in the capacity transfer constraint (EQ(l)_CPT). Amount of investments (VAR_NCAP) remaining past the modelling horizon that needs to be credited back to the objective function (EQ_OBJINV).

parameters.Name: FLO_BND
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: MIGIf the bound is specified for a timeslice s being above the flow timeslice resolution (rtpcs_varf), the bound is applied to the sum of the flow variables (VAR_FLO) according to the timeslice tree, otherwise directly to the flow variable. No aggregation.
parameters.Description: Bound on the flow of a commodity or the sum of flows within a commodity group.
parameters.Equations: Flow activity limit constraint (EQ(l)_FLOBND) when s is above rtpcs_varf Direct bound on activity variable (VAR_FLO) when at the rtpcs_varf level.

parameters.Name: FLO_COST
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance Weighted aggregation
parameters.Description: Variable cost of a process associated with the production/ consumption of a commodity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: FLO_CUM
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: N/AThe years y1 and y2 may be any years of the set allyear; where y1 may also be 'BOH' for first year of first period and y2 may be 'EOH' for last year of last period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the cumulative amount of annual process activity between the years y1 and y2, within a region.
parameters.Equations: Generates an instance of the cumulative constraint (EQ_CUMFLO)

parameters.Name: FLO_DELIV
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Cost of a delivering (consuming) a commodity to a process.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: FLO_EFF
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit of c / commodity unit of cg [open];
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDInherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the flow variables of the commodities in group cg. All parameters with the same process (p) and target commodity (c) are combined in the same transformation equation. By using cg='ACT', the attribute will be defined per unit of activity, by applying it on all PCG flows with the value divided by any user-defined PRC_ACTFLO. FLO_EFF defined for an individual flow will override any value for a group.
parameters.Description: Defines the amount of commodity flow of commodity (c) per unit of other process flow(s) or activity (cg).
parameters.Equations: Generates process transformation equation (EQ_PTRANS) between one or more input (or output) commodities and one output (or input) commodities.

parameters.Name: FLO_EMIS
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit of c / commodity unit of cg [open];
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDSee FLO_EFF. If com is of type ENV and is not in the process topology, it is added to it as an output flow.
parameters.Description: Defines the amount of emissions (c) per unit of process flow(s) or activity (cg).
parameters.Equations: See FLO_EFF.

parameters.Name: FLO_FR
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: MIGFLO_FR may be specified as lower, upper or fixed bounds, in contrast to COM_FR. Can be specified for any flow variable having a subannual timeslice resolution. Weighted aggregation. Direct inheritance, if defined at the ANNUAL level.
parameters.Description: 1) Bounds the flow of commodity (c) entering or leaving process (p) in a timeslice, in proportion to annual flow. 2) If specified also at the ANNUAL level, bounds the flow level in proportion to the average level under the parent timeslice
parameters.Equations: A share equation (EQ(l)_FLOFR) limiting the amount of commodity (c) is generated according to the bound type (bd = l indicator).

parameters.Name: FLO_FUNC
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit of cg2/commodity unit of cg1 [open];
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDIf for the same indexes the parameter FLO_SUM is specified but no FLO_FUNC, the FLO_FUNC is set to 1. Important factor in determining the level at which a process operates in that the derived transformation parameter (COEF_PTRAN) is inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the flow variables associated with the commodities in the group cg1.
parameters.Description: A key parameter describing the basic operation of or within a process. Sets the ratio between the sum of flows in commodity group cg2 to the sum of flows in commodity group cg1, thereby defining the efficiency of producing cg2 from cg1 (subject to any FLO_SUM). cg1 and cg2 may be also single commodities.
parameters.Equations: Establishes the basic transformation relationship (EQ_PTRANS) between one or more input (or output) commodities and one or more output (or input) commodities. Establishes the relationship between storage charging / discharging and a related commodity flow (VAR_FLO) in the auxiliary storage flow equation (EQ_STGAUX).

parameters.Name: FLO_FUNCX
parameters.Instances: Default extrapolation: MIGProvided when shaping based upon age is desired. Vintaged processes only (or for NCAP_COM flows). Note: Shape index 1 is reserved for constant 1. ACT_EFF(cg): cg1=cg, cg2='ACT' ACT_FLO(cg): cg1='ACT', cg2=cg FLO_EMIS(cg,c): cg1=cg2=c FLO_EFF(cg,c): cg1=cg2=c FLO_FUNC(cg1,cg2): cgN=cgN NCAP_COM(com): cg1='CAPFLO', cg2=com
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the flow parameters (ACT_EFF/ACT_FLO/ FLO_FUNC/FLO_SUM/ FLO_EMIS/FLO_EFF/ NCAP_COM)
parameters.Equations: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) in a transformation equation (EQ_PTRANS / EQE_ACTEFF) to account for changes in the transformation efficiency according to the age of each process vintage.

parameters.Name: FLO_MARK
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDThe same given fraction is applied to all timeslices of the commodity (this could be generalized to allow time-slice-specific fractions, if deemed useful). If an ANNUAL level market- share is desired for a timesliced commodity, PRC_MARK can be used instead.
parameters.Description: Process-wise market share in total commodity production.
parameters.Equations: The individual process flow variables (VAR_FLO, VAR_IN, VAR_STGIN/OUT) are constrained (EQ(l)_FLOMRK) to a fraction of the total production of a commodity (VAR_COMPRD). Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: FLO_PKCOI
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDFLO_PKCOI is specified for individual processes p consuming the peak commodity c. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. Used when the timeslices are not necessarily fine enough to pick up the actual peak within the peak timeslices.
parameters.Description: Factor that permits attributing more (or less) demand to the peaking equation (EQ_PEAK) than the average demand calculated by the model, to handle the situation where peak usage is typically higher (or lower) due to coincidental (or non-coincidental) loads at the time of the peak demand.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) to adjust the amount of a commodity consumed when considering the average demand contributing to the peaking constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: FLO_SHAR
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: MIG over milestoneyears, STD over pastyearsDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation. A common example of using FLO_SHAR is to specify the power-to-heat ratio of CHP plants in the backpressure point. For example, for a heat output of a CHP technology, the FLO_SHAR parameter would have the value CHPR/(1+CHPR), with CHPR being the heat-to- power ratio.
parameters.Description: Share of flow commodity c based upon the sum of individual flows defined by the commodity group cg belonging to process p.
parameters.Equations: When the commodity is an input an EQ(l)_INSHR equation is generated. When the commodity is an output an EQ(l)_OUTSHR equation is generated.

parameters.Name: FLO_SUB
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDDirect inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Subsidy on a process flow.
parameters.Equations: Applied with a minus sign to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: FLO_SUM
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit of cg2/commodity unit of c [open];
parameters.Instances: Default i/e: STDIf a FLO_SUM is specified and no corresponding FLO_FUNC, the FLO_FUNC is set to 1. If FLO_FUNC is specified for a true commodity group cg1, and no FLO_SUM is specified for the commodities in cg1, these FLO_SUM are set to 1. The derived parameter COEF_PTRANS is inherited/aggregated to the timeslice level of the flow variable of the commodity c.
parameters.Description: Multiplier applied for commodity c of group cg1 corresponding to the flow rate based upon the sum of individual flows defined by the commodity group cg2 of process p. Most often used to define the emission rate, or to adjust the overall efficiency of a technology based upon fuel consumed.
parameters.Equations: The FLO_SUM multiplier is applied along with FLO_FUNC parameter in the transformation coefficient (COEF_PTRANS), which is applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) in the transformation equation (EQ_PTRANS).

parameters.Name: FLO_TAX
parameters.Instances: Direct inheritance.
parameters.Description: Tax on a process
parameters.Equations: Applied to the flow

parameters.Name: CST_FLOX
parameters.Instances: Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: commodity unit
parameters.Equations: flow. variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: G_CUREX
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from currency cur1 to currency cur2, with cur2 to be used in the objective function. The target currency cur2 must have a discount rate defined with G_DRATE.
parameters.Equations: Affects cost coefficients in EQ_OBJ

parameters.Name: G_CYCLE
parameters.Default values:
Default values:
·1 for ANNUAL
·1 for SEASON
·52 for WEEKLY
·365 for DAYNITE
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Defines the total number of cycles on level tslvl, in a year. Provides default values for TS_CYCLE (see entry for that). Not recommended to be changed; use TS_CYCLE instead, whenever the timeslice cycles are different from the default, because changing G_CYCLE would change the meaning of storage availability factors.
parameters.Equations: Affects interpretation of availability factors for the storage level, whenever capacity represents the maximum nominal output level (EQ(l)_CAPACT, EQL_CAPFLO).

parameters.Name: G_DRATE
parameters.Related sets:
OBJ_DISC,
OBJ_DCEOH,
NCAP_DRATE,
COR_SALVI,
COR_SALVD,
COEF_PVT
VDA_DISC
parameters.Instances: STDA value must be provided for each region. Interpolation is dense (all individual years included).
parameters.Description: System-wide discount rate in region r for each time-period.
parameters.Equations: The discount rate is taken into consideration when constructing the objective function discounting multiplier (OBJ_DISC), which is applied in each components of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR, EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: G_DYEAR
parameters.Default values:
default value =
M(MIYR_1), i.e. the
first milestone year
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Base year for discounting.
parameters.Equations: The year to which all costs are to be discounted is taken into consideration when constructing the objective function discounting multiplier (OBJ_DISC), which is applied in each of the components of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR, EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: G_RFRIR
parameters.Instances: STDOptional parameter. If value is not provided, G_DRATE is assumed as the risk-free rate. By providing G_RFRIR, the technology-specific risk premiums can be kept unchanged over any sensitivity analyses with different G_DRATE values.
parameters.Description: Risk-free real interest rate in region r for each time-period. Provides the reference rate for NCAP_DRATE, such that the risk premium will be calculated against the risk-free rate.
parameters.Equations: The rate is taken into consideration when constructing the objective function coefficients for investment costs. EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: G_ILEDNO
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: If the ratio of lead-time (NCAP_ILED) to the period duration (D) is below this threshold then the lead-time consideration will be ignored in the objective function Only provided when the costs associated with the lead-time for new capacity (NCAP_ILED) are not to be included in the objective function. Not taken into account if the OBLONG switch or any alternative objective formulation is used.
parameters.Equations: Prevents the investment costs associated with investment lead-times from energy the investment component of the objective function (EQ_OBJINV).

parameters.Name: G_NOINTERP
parameters.Related sets:
All parameters
that are normally
subjected to
interpolation /
extrapolation
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Switch for generally turning-on (= 0 ) and turning-off (= 1 ) sparse inter- / extrapolation. Only provide when interpolation / extrapolation is to be turned off for all parameters. Interpolation of cost parameters is always done.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: G_OFFTHD
parameters.Instances: Setting G_OFFTHD=1 will make the *_OFF attributes effective only for periods fully included in the OFF range specified.
parameters.Description: Threshold for considering an *_OFF attribute disabling a process/commodity variable in period.
parameters.Equations:
Affects availability of VAR_NCAP,
VAR_ACT, VAR_FLO,
VAR_COMNET/PRD

parameters.Name: G_OVERLAP
parameters.Instances: Used only when time-stepped solution is activated with the TIMESTEP control variable.
parameters.Description: Overlap of stepped solutions (in years).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: G_TLIFE
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Default value for the technical lifetime of a process if not provided by the user.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: G_YRFR
parameters.Default values:
default value: none;
only for the ANNUAL
timeslice a value of 1
is predefined
parameters.Instances: Must be provided for each region and timeslice.
parameters.Description: Duration of timeslice s as fraction of a year. Used for shaping the load curve and lining up timeslice duration for inter-regional exchanges.
parameters.Equations: Applied to various variables (VAR_NCAP+PASTI, VAR_COMX, VAR_IRE, VAR_FLO, VAR_SIN/OUT) in the commodity balance equation (EQ(l)_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: IRE_BND
parameters.Instances: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). If the bound is specified for a timeslice (s) being above the commodity (c) timeslice resolution, the bound is applied to the sum of the imports/exports according to the timeslice tree. Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description: Bound on the total import (export) of commodity (c) from (to) region all_r in (out of) region r.
parameters.Equations: Controls the instances for which the trade bound constraint (EQ(l)_IREBND) is generated, and the RHS.

parameters.Name: IRE_CCVT
parameters.Default values:
Default value: 1 if
commodity names are
the same in both
regions
parameters.Instances: Required for mapping commodities involved in inter-regional exchanges between two regions whenever commodities traded are in different units in the regions.
parameters.Description: Conversion factor between commodity units in region r1 and region r2. Expresses the amount of commodity c2 in region r2 equivalent to 1 unit of commodity c1 in region r1.
parameters.Equations: The conversion factor is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the inter-regional balance constraint (EQ_IRE). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an inter-regional exchange is bounded in the limit constraint (EQ(l)_IREBND). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an exchange with an external region is bounded (EQ(l)_XBND).

parameters.Name: IRE_FLO
parameters.Instances: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE) between two internal regions. Note that for each direction of trade a separate IRE_FLO needs to be specified. Similar to FLO_FUNC for standard processes. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Efficiency of exchange process from commodity c1 in region r1 to commodity c2 in the region2 in timeslice s2; the timeslice s2 refers to the r2 region.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the exchange flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the inter-regional trade equation (EQ_IRE). Applied to the exchange flow variable (VAR_IRE) when a bound on inter-regional trade is to be applied (EQ(l)_IREBND).

parameters.Name: IRE_FLOSUM
parameters.Instances: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). Since the efficiency IRE_FLO can only be used for exchange between internal regions, IRE_FLOSUM may be used to define an efficiency for an import/export with an external region by specifying the same commodity for c1 and c2 and the value 1-efficiency as auxiliary consumption. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Auxiliary consumption (io = IN, owing to the commodity entering the process) or production/ emission (io = OUT, owing to the commodity leaving the process) of commodity c2 due to the IMPort / EXPort (index ie) of the commodity c1 in region r30
parameters.Equations: The multiplier is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) associated with an inter-reginal exchange in the commodity balance constraint (EQ(l)_COMBAL). If a flow share (FLO_SHAR) is provided for an inter-regional exchange process then the multiplier is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the share constraint (EQ(l)_IN/OUTSHR). If a cost is provided for the flow (FLO_COST or FLO_DELIV) then the factor is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the variable component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: IRE_PRICE
parameters.Instances: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). Ignored if all_r is an internal region. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: IMPort/EXPort price (index ie) for to/from an internal region of a commodity (c) originating from/heading to an external region all_r.
parameters.Equations: The price of the exchange commodity is applied to the trade flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the variable costs component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: IRE_TSCVT
parameters.Default values:
default value: 1 if
timeslice tree and
names are the same
in both regions
parameters.Instances: Used for mapping timeslices in different regions. Required if timeslice definitions are different in the regions.
parameters.Description: Matrix for mapping timeslices; the value for (r1,s1,r2,s2) gives the fraction of timeslice s2 in region r2 that falls in timeslice s1 in region r1.
parameters.Equations: The conversion factor is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the inter-regional balance constraint (EQ_IRE). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an inter-regional exchange is bounded in the limit constraint (EQ(l)_IREBND). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an exchange with an external region is bounded (EQ(l)_XBND).

parameters.Name: IRE_XBND
parameters.Instances: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). Provide whenever a trade flow is to be constrained. Note that the limit is either imposed by summing lower or splitting higher flow variables (VAR_IRE) when specified at other than the actual flow level (as determined by the commodity and process levels (COM_TSL/ PRC_TSL ).
parameters.Description: Bound on the total IMPort (EXPort) (index ie) of commodity c in region all_r with all sources (destinations).
parameters.Equations: The trade limit equation EQ(l)_XBND generated either sums lower flow variables (VAR_IRE) or splits (according to the timeslice tree) coarser variables.

parameters.Name: MULTI
parameters.Instances: Only provided when the related shaping parameters are to be used.
parameters.Description: Multiplier table used for any shaping parameters (*_*M) to adjust the corresponding technical data as function of the year; the table contains different multiplier curves identified by the index j.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_AF
parameters.Instances: NCAP_AF, NCAP_AFA and NCAP_AFS can be applied simultaneously. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. (Important remark: No inheritance/aggregation if any value is specified at process timeslices.)
parameters.Description: Availability factor relating a unit of production (process activity) in timeslice s to the current installed capacity.
parameters.Equations: The corresponding capacity-activity constraint (EQ(l)_CAPACT) will be generated for any timeslice s. If the process timeslice level (PRC_TSL) is below said level, the activity variables will be summed.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFA
parameters.Instances: Provided when ‘ANNUAL’ level process operation is to be controlled. NCAP_AF, NCAP_AFA and NCAP_AFS can be applied simultaneously. NCAP_AFA is always assumed to be non-vintage dependent, even if the process is defined as a vintaged one; for vintage-dependent annual availability NCAP_AFS with s=’ANNUAL’ can be used.
parameters.Description: Annual availability factor relating the annual activity of a process to the installed capacity.
parameters.Equations: The corresponding capacity-activity constraint (EQ(l)_CAPACT) will be generated for the ‘ANNUAL’ timeslice. If the process timeslice level (PRC_TSL) is below said level, the activity variables will be summed.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFC
parameters.Instances: If the commodities are in the PCG, constraint is applied to the flows in the PCG as a whole (linear combination of flows). Independent equations are generated for commodities not in the PCG, or when NCAP_AFC(r,’0’,p,’ACT’,tsl) =–1 is also specified.
parameters.Description: Commodity-specific availability of capacity for commodity group cg, at given timeslice level. Applies also matching NCAP_AF / AFS / AFA as a multiplier, unless the independent option is used.
parameters.Equations: Generates instances of EQ(l)_CAFLAC (thereby disabling EQ(l)_CAPACT generation), or EQL_CAPFLO.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFCS
parameters.Instances: See NCAP_AFC. NCAP_AFCS is similar to NCAP_AFC but is defined on individual timeslices. Overrides NCAP_AFC.
parameters.Description: Commodity-specific availability of capacity for commodity group cg, timeslice-specific.
parameters.Equations: See NCAP_AFC.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFM
parameters.Instances: Provided when multiplication of NCAP_AF / NCAP_AFS based upon year is desired. Note: Multiplier index 1 is reserved for constant 1.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) to be applied to the availability factor parameters (NCAP_AF/AFA/AFS) of a process.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFS
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Availability factor
parameters.Equations: The corresponding

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFS
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: relating the activity of a process in a timeslice s being at or above the process timeslice level (prc_tsl) to the installed capacity. If for example the process timeslice level is ‘DAYNITE’ and NCAP_AFS is specified for timeslices on the ‘SEASONAL’ level, the sum of the ‘DAYNITE’ activities within a season are restricted, but not the ‘DAYNITE’ activities directly.
parameters.Equations: capacity-activity constraint (EQ(l)_CAPACT)

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFSX
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the seasonal availability factor parameters (NCAP_ AFS) of a process.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFX
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the availability factor parameters (NCAP_AF/AFA/AFS) of a process.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_BND
parameters.Instances: Provided for each process to have its overall installed capacity (VAR_NCAP) limited in a period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the permitted level on investment in new capacity
parameters.Equations: Imposes an indirect limit on the capacity transfer equation (EQ_CPT) by means of a direct bound on the new investments capacity variable (VAR_NCAP).

parameters.Name: NCAP_BPME
parameters.Instances: The parameter is only taken into account when the process is of type CHP, and NCAP_CDME has been also defined.
parameters.Description: Back pressure mode efficiency (or total efficiency in full CHP mode).
parameters.Equations: Process transformation equation, either EQE_ACTEFF or EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: NCAP_CDME
parameters.Instances: The parameter can only be used for standard process-es having electricity output in the PCG.
parameters.Description: Condensing mode efficiency
parameters.Equations: Process transformation equation, either EQE_ACTEFF or EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: NCAP_CEH
parameters.Instances: The parameter is only taken into account when the process is defined to be of type CHP.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of electricity to heat along the iso-fuel line in a pass-out CHP technology.
parameters.Equations: Process transformation equation, either EQE_ACTEFF or EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: NCAP_CHPR
parameters.Instances: The parameter is only taken into account when the process is defined to be of type CHP.
parameters.Description: Heat-to-power ratio of a CHP technology (fixed / minimum / maximum ratio). If no ratio equations should be generated, one can define any I/E value with lim='N'.
parameters.Equations: Activates the generation of output share equations, implemented with EQ(l)_OUTSHR

parameters.Name: NCAP_CLAG
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a delay in commodity output after commissioning new capacity.
parameters.Description: Lagtime of a commodity after new capacity is installed.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) of the investment period or previous periods.

parameters.Name: NCAP_CLED
parameters.Instances: Provided when a commodity must be available prior to availability of a process.
parameters.Description: Lead time requirement for a commodity during construction (NCAP_ICOM), prior to the initial availability of the capacity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) of the investment period or previous periods.

parameters.Name: NCAP_COM
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when the consumption or production of a commodity is tied to the level of the installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Emission (or land-use) of commodity c associated with the capacity of a process for each year said capacity exists.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the capacity variable (VAR_CAP) in the commodity balance (EQ_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: NCAP_COST
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided whenever there is a cost associated with putting new capacity in place.
parameters.Description: Investment costs of new installed capacity according to the installation year.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: NCAP_CPX
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Defines a shape index for shaping the capacity transfer coefficients by the age of each process vintage. As a result, the capacity will have a survival rate as a function of age.
parameters.Equations: Impacts all calculations that are dependent upon the availability of capacity (VAR_NCAP), most directly the capacity transfer (EQ_CPT), and capacity availability equations  (EQ(l)_CAPACT).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DCOST
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there are decommissioning costs associated with a process.
parameters.Description: Cost of dismantling a facility after the end of its lifetime.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the current capacity subject to decommissioning (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DELIF
parameters.Instances: Provided when the timeframe for paying for decommission is different from that of the actual decommissioning.
parameters.Description: Economic lifetime of the decommissioning activity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the salvage portion of the objective function (EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DISC
parameters.Instances: Used for lumpy investments.
parameters.Description: Size of capacity units that can be added.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the lumpy investment integer variable (VAR_DNCAP) in the discrete investment equation (EQ_DSCNCAP) to set the corresponding standard investment variable level (VAR_NCAP).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DLAG
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a lag in the decommissioning of a process (e.g., to allow the nuclear core to reduce its radiation).
parameters.Description: Number of years delay before decommissioning can begin after the lifetime of a technology has ended.
parameters.Equations: Delay applied to a decommissioning flow (VAR_FLO) in the balance equation (EQ(l)_COMBAL) as production. Delay applied to the current capacity subject to decommissioning (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DLAGC
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a cost during any lag in the decommissioning (e.g., security).
parameters.Description: Cost occurring during the lag time after the technical lifetime of a process has ended and before its decommissioning starts.
parameters.Equations: Cost during delay applied to the current capacity subject to decommissioning (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DLIFE
parameters.Instances: Provided when a process has a decommissioning phase.
parameters.Description: Technical time for dismantling a facility after the end its technical lifetime, plus any lag time (NCAP_DLAG).
parameters.Equations: Decommissioning time impacting (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DRATE
parameters.Instances: Provided if the cost of borrowing for a process is different from the standard discount rate.
parameters.Description: Technology specific discount rate.
parameters.Equations: Discount rate applied to investments (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_ELIFE
parameters.Instances: Provided only when the economic lifetime differs from the technical lifetime (NCAP_TLIFE).
parameters.Description: Economic lifetime of a process.
parameters.Equations: Economic lifetime of a process when costing investment (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) or capacity in the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJFIX).

parameters.Name: NCAP_FDR
parameters.Instances: Provided when the effect of functional depreciation is considered significant to justify accelerated decrease in salvage value.
parameters.Description: Defines an annual rate of additional depreciation in the salvage value.
parameters.Equations: Affects the salvage value coefficients in EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: NCAP_FOM
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a fixed cost associated with the installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Fixed operating and maintenance cost per unit of capacity according to the installation year.
parameters.Equations: Fixed operating and maintenance costs associated with total installed capacity (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJFIX).

parameters.Name: NCAP_FOMM
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon the period is desired.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) applied to the fixed operating and maintenance costs (NCAP_FOM).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FOMX
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the fixed operating and maintenance cost.
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FSUB
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a subsidy for associated with the level of installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Subsidy per unit of installed capacity.
parameters.Equations: Fixed subsidy associated with total installed capacity (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function component (EQ_OBJFIX) with a minus sign.

parameters.Name: NCAP_FSUBM
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon the period is desired.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) applied to the subsidy (NCAP_FSUB).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FSUBX
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the fixed subsidy (NCAP_FSUB).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FTAX
parameters.Units/Ranges: monetary unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a fixed tax based upon the level of the installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Tax per unit of installed capacity.
parameters.Equations: Fixed subsidy associated with total installed capacity (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJFIX).

parameters.Name: NCAP_FTAXM
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon the period is desired.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) applied to the tax (NCAP_FTAX).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FTAXX
parameters.Instances: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the fixed tax (NCAP_FTAX).
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_ICOM
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when a commodity is needed in the period in which the new capacity is to be available,
parameters.Description: Amount of commodity (c) required for the construction of new capacity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the appropriate commodity

parameters.Name: NCAP_ILED
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a delay between when the investment decision occurs and when the capacity (new capacity or past investment) is initially available.
parameters.Description: Lead time between investment decision and actual availability of new capacity (= construction time).
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) balance constraints (EQ(l)_COMBAL) as part of consumption, if there is an associated flow (NCAP_ICOM). Used as to distinguish between small and large investments (VAR_NCAP) and thus influences the way the investment and fixed costs are treated in the objective function (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_ISPCT
parameters.Instances: Provided when defining an investment subsidy in proportion to the investment cost. Requires that NCAP_COST is defined.
parameters.Description: Unit investment subsidy as a fraction of unit investment costs, in the same currency unit, per unit of new capacity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV) with a minus sign.

parameters.Name: NCAP_ISUB
parameters.Units/Ranges: monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a subsidy for new investments in a period.
parameters.Description: Subsidy per unit of new installed capacity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV) with a minus sign. May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: NCAP_ITAX
parameters.Units/Ranges: monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a tax associated with new investments in a period.
parameters.Description: Tax per unit of new installed capacity
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: NCAP_MSPRF
parameters.Instances: Optional parameter for the logit market sharing mechanism, for process p supplying market c.
parameters.Description: In the logit market sharing mechanism, defines preference weights (lim='N') and intangible costs (lim='LO')
parameters.Equations: EQ_MSNCAPB

parameters.Name: NCAP_OCOM
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when there is a commodity release associated with the decommissioning.
parameters.Description: Amount of commodity c per unit of capacity released during the dismantling of a process.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the appropriate commodity constraints (EQ(l)_COMBAL) as part of production in the appropriate period.

parameters.Name: NCAP_OLIFE
parameters.Instances: Requires that early retirements are enabled and the process is vintaged.
parameters.Description: Maximum operating lifetime of a process, in terms of full-load years.
parameters.Equations: EQL_SCAP

parameters.Name: NCAP_PASTI
parameters.Instances: Past investment can also be specified for milestone years, e.g. if the milestone year is a historic year, so that capacity additions are known or if planned future investments are already known.
parameters.Description: Investment in new capacity made before the beginning of the model horizon (in the year specified by pastyear).
parameters.Equations: EQ(l)_COMBAL, EQ_CPT, EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJFIX

parameters.Name: NCAP_PASTY
parameters.Instances: Provided to spread a single past investment (NCAP_PASTI) back over several years (e.g., cars in the period before the 1st milestoneyr were bought over the previous 15 years). If overlaps with other past investments, the capacity values are added.
parameters.Description: Number of years to go back to calculate a linear build-up of past investments
parameters.Equations: {See NCAP_PASTI}

parameters.Name: NCAP_PKCNT
parameters.Instances: If the indicator PRC_PKAF is specified, the NCAP_PKCNT is set equal to the availabilities NCAP_AF. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Fraction of capacity that can contribute to peaking equations.
parameters.Equations: Applied to investments in capacity (VAR_NCAP, NCAP_PASTI) in the peaking constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: NCAP_SEMI
parameters.Instances: Upper bound for the capacity must be defined by NCAP_BND; if not defined, assumed to be equal to the lower bound. Requires MIP.
parameters.Description: Semi-continuous new capacity, lower bound. (See Section 5.9)
parameters.Equations: Applied to the semi-continuous investment variable VAR_SNCAP in the discrete investment equation EQ_DSCNCAP

parameters.Name: NCAP_START
parameters.Instances: NCAP_START(r,p)=y is equivalent to PRC_NOFF(r,p,BOH,y–1).
parameters.Description: Start year for new investments
parameters.Equations: Affects the availability of investment variable (VAR_NCAP)

parameters.Name: NCAP_TLIFE
parameters.Instances: Expected for all technologies that have investment costs. Values below 0.5 cannot be well accounted in the objective function, and should thus be avoided (they are automatically resetted to 1).
parameters.Description: Technical lifetime of a process.
parameters.Equations: Impacts all calculations that are dependent upon the availability of investments (VAR_NCAP) including capacity transfer (EQ_CPT), commodity flow (EQ(l)_COMBAL), costs (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJVAR, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_VALU
parameters.Units/Ranges: Monetary unit / commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Instances: Provided when a released commodity has a value.
parameters.Description: Value of a commodity released at decommissioning (NCAP_OCOM).
parameters.Equations: Applied to the investment related (VAR_NCAP, NCAP_PASTI) release flow at decommissioning in the objective function (EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: PRC_ACTFLO
parameters.Units/Ranges: Commodity unit / activity unit (0,∞); default value: 1
parameters.Instances: Only (rarely) provided when either the activity and flow variables of a process are in different units, or if there is a conversion efficiency between the activity and the flow(s) in the PCG. The group (cg) can be the whole PCG or any individual commodity in the PCG, or 'ACT' (=PCG).
parameters.Description: 1) Conversion factor from units of activity to units of those flow variables that define the activity (primary commodity group), or, 2) Conversion multiplier representing the amount of flow(s) in the cg per 1 unit of activity.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the primary commodity (prc_pcg) flow variables (VAR_FLO, VAR_IRE) to relate overall activity (VAR_ACT in EQ_ACTFLO). When the Reduction algorithm activated it is applied to the activity variable (VAR_ACT) in those cases where the flow variable (VAR_FLO) can be replaced by the activity variable (e.g. the activity is defined by one commodity flow).

parameters.Name: PRC_CAPACT
parameters.Units/Ranges: Activity unit / capacity unit (0,∞); default value: 1
parameters.Instances: none
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from capacity unit to activity unit assuming that the capacity is used for one year.
parameters.Equations: Applied along with the availability factor (NCAP_AF) to the investment (VAR_NCAP + NCAP_PASTI) in the utilization equations (EQ(l)_CAPACT, EQ(l)_CAFLAC). Applied to the investment (VAR_NCAP + NCAP_PASTI) in the peak constraint (EQ_PEAK). Applied to the investment (VAR_NCAP + NCAP_PASTI) in the capacity utilization constraint for CHP plants (ECT_AFCHP) and peak constraint in the IER extension (see Part III).

parameters.Name: PRC_GMAP
parameters.Instances: Provided when process groupings are needed for custom processing e.g. in a TIMES code extension.
parameters.Description: User-defined grouping of processes by group indicator item.
parameters.Equations: None

parameters.Name: PRC_MARK
parameters.Instances: Combined limit on commodity production is derived as the sum of the process-specific productions multiplied by the inverse values of PRC_MARK. The constraint is applied to the annual production of commodity. Item can be a any desired label identifying the group.
parameters.Description: Process group-wise market share, which defines a constraint for the combined market share of multiple processes in the total commodity production.
parameters.Equations: EQ(l)_FLOMRK, VAR_COMPRD

parameters.Name: PRC_REFIT
parameters.Instances: Requires that early retirements are allowed in the model. The parameter value determines the type of the refurbishment option
parameters.Description: Defines a mapping of host process prc to a retrofit or lifetime extension option p in region r, where p is another process representing the refurbishment option. The value of the parameter determines the type of the refurbishment option (see column on the left).
parameters.Equations: Activates generation of the retrofit / lifetime extension equations (EQL_REFIT)

parameters.Name: PRC_RESID
parameters.Instances: If only a single data point is specified, linear decay of the specified residual capacity over technical lifetime is assumed. Used as an alternative to NCAP_PASTI, not to use both for the same process.
parameters.Description: Residual existing capacity stock of process (p) still available in the year specified (datayear). PRC_RESID is most useful for describing the stock of capacity with mixed vintages, while NCAP_PASTI is suited for capacities of a certain vintages, such as an individual power plants.
parameters.Equations: EQ(l)_CAPACT, EQ(l)_CAFLAC, EQL_CAPFLO, EQ(l)_CPT, VAR_CAP

parameters.Name: R_CUREX
parameters.Instances: The target currency cur2 must have a discount rate defined with G_DRATE.
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from currency cur1 to currency cur2 in region r, in order to use cur2 in the objective function.
parameters.Equations: Affects cost coefficients in EQ_OBJ

parameters.Name: RCAP_BLK
parameters.Instances: Only effective when lumpy early capacity retirements are active (RETIRE=MIP). Requires MIP.
parameters.Description: Retirement block size.
parameters.Equations: EQ_DSCRET, VAR_DRCAP, VAR_SCAP

parameters.Name: RCAP_BND
parameters.Instances: Unless the control variable DSCAUTO=YES, requires that PRC_RCAP is defined for process p.
parameters.Description: Bound on the retired amount of capacity in a period (same bound for all vintages).
parameters.Equations: VAR_RCAP, VAR_SCAP

parameters.Name: REG_BDNCAP
parameters.Instances: Only taken into account when a previous solution is loaded by using the LPOINT control variable. If several bound types are specified, one can use NCAP_BND(r,'0',p,'N')=±1 for assigning only an UP/LO bound for any process p.
parameters.Description: Defines the year up to which capacities are to be bounded by previous solution, by model region. One can choose FX/UP/LO bounds, as well as lower bounds only for selected processes.
parameters.Equations: VAR_NCAP

parameters.Name: REG_BNDCST
parameters.Instances: The cost aggregations (agg) supported are listed in the set COSTAGG (see Table 1).
parameters.Description: Bound on regional costs by type of cost aggregation.
parameters.Equations: EQ_BNDCST, VAR_CUMCST

parameters.Name: REG_CUMCST
parameters.Instances: The cost aggregations (agg) supported are listed in the set COSTAGG (see Table 1).
parameters.Description: Cumulative bound on regional costs by type of cost aggregation.
parameters.Equations: EQ_BNDCST, VAR_CUMCST

parameters.Name: REG_FIXT
parameters.Instances: Only taken into account when the first periods are fixed by using the FIXBOH control variable.
parameters.Description: Defines the year up to which periods are fixed to previous solution, by region–
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: RPT_OPT
parameters.Instances: See Part III, Table 15 for a list and descriptions of available options.
parameters.Description: Miscellaneous reporting options
parameters.Equations: none

parameters.Name: SHAPE
parameters.Related sets: FLO_FUNC, FLO_SUM, NCAP_AFX, NCAP_FOMX, NCAP_FSUBX, NCAP_FTAXX
parameters.Instances: Provided for each age dependent shaping curve that is to be applied.
parameters.Description: Multiplier table used for any shaping parameters (*_*X) to adjust the corresponding technical data as function of the age;
parameters.Equations: {See Related Parameters}

parameters.Name: STG_CHRG
parameters.Instances: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: Annual exogenous charging of a storage technology in a particular timeslice s.
parameters.Equations: Exogenous charging of storage enters storage equations (EQ_STGTSS, EQ_STGIPS) as right-hand side constant.

parameters.Name: STG_EFF
parameters.Instances: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: Efficiency of storage process.
parameters.Equations: Applied to the storage output flow (VAR_SOUT) in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) for the stored commodity.

parameters.Name: STG_LOSS
parameters.Instances: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: STG_LOSS>0 defines the loss in proportion to the initial storage level during one year’s storage time. STG_LOSS<0 defines an equilibrium loss, i.e. how much the annual losses would be if the storage level is kept constant.Annual loss of a storage process per unit of average energy stored.
parameters.Equations: Timeslice storage process (EQ_STGTSS): applied to the average storage level (VAR_ACT) between two consecutive timeslices.
